Enumeration Type Documentation

enum CONFIG_AREA

config area

Enumerator:
MAXIM_INFO 

maxim config area

VENDOR_INFO 

vendor config area

LAST_INFO 

max config area for validation

enum EP_CONFIG

endpoint configuration

Enumerator:
MAXIM_ISOC 

isoc

MAXIM_BULK 

bulk

enum GET_ALL_KEY_STATE

represents registered callback function state of mxcam_get_all_key_values function

Enumerator:
GET_ALL_KEY_VALID 

found an valid key and value pair

GET_ALL_KEY_COMPLETED 

config area parsing is completed

GET_ALL_KEY_NO_KEY 

found a empty config area

Function Documentation

int mxcam_get_all_key_values ( CONFIG_AREA  area,
void(*)(GET_ALL_KEY_STATE st, int keycnt, void *key, void *value)  callback 
)

mxcam_get_all_key_values: get all configuration records from camera for a sepecific CONFIG_AREA

Parameters:
area :area to get all configuration records
*callback :register the callbk function pointer here, _callbk_ will be invoked when mxcam_get_all_key_values gets a valid record,end of config area or found an empty config area
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_GET_CFG_SIZE_UNKNOWN_AREA - if area >= LAST_INFO
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
get all configuration records from camera for a specific CONFIG_AREA .The function _callbk_ will be invoked when mxcam_get_all_key_values gets a valid record,end of config area or found an empty config area
int mxcam_get_ccr_size ( CONFIG_AREA  area,
unsigned short *  size_out 
)

mxcam_get_ccr_size: get the size of the complete ccr list

Parameters:
area :area to get ccr list size.
size_out :returns identified size from the camera
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • size_out is not a valid pointer
MXCAM_ERR_GET_CFG_SIZE_UNKNOWN_AREA - if area >= LAST_INFO
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
this will read just the size of ccr list from camera and return it in size_out.
int mxcam_read_ccr_mem ( CONFIG_AREA  area,
char *  buf,
unsigned short  len 
)

mxcam_read_ccr_mem: get the complete ccr list from camera

Parameters:
area :area to get ccr list size.
buf :buffer to read the ccr list
len :size of the data to be read from camera
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • buf is NULL
  • len is zero
  • area >= LAST_INFO
MXCAM_ERR_UNINITIALIZED_VENDOR_MEMORY- if libusb returns LIBUSB_ERROR_PIPE
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
this will read the specified length(parameter len) size of data from camera and returns' it in parameter buf.
int mxcam_get_all_ccr ( void(*)(GET_ALL_KEY_STATE st, int keycnt, void *data)  callbk  ) 

mxcam_get_all_ccr: get the complete ccr from camera

Parameters:
*callbk :register the callbk function pointer here, _callbk_ will be invoked before and after the file transfer over usb
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • buf is NULL
  • len is zero
  • area >= LAST_INFO
MXCAM_ERR_UNINITIALIZED_VENDOR_MEMORY- if libusb returns LIBUSB_ERROR_PIPE
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
this gets the size of the complete ccr using mxcam_get_ccr_size and reads the coplete ccr using mxcam_read_ccr_mem and finally for every ccr record it invokes the _callbk_ function
int mxcam_erase_eeprom_config ( CONFIG_AREA  area,
unsigned short  size 
)

mxcam_erase_eeprom_config: erase a specific CONFIG_AREA on camera persistent storage memory

Parameters:
area :area is erase the config area
size :size of vendor size area for maxim area size is fixed as 1K
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • area >= LAST_INFO
  • area == VENDOR_INFO && size <= 12
MXCAM_ERR_ERASE_SIZE -if erase size exceeds MAX_VEND_SIZE
MXCAM_ERR_ERASE_UNKNOWN_AREA - unknown erase CONFIG_AREA
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
erase a specific CONFIG_AREA on camera persistent storage memory. see also mxcam_get_config_size
int mxcam_save_eeprom_config ( CONFIG_AREA  area  ) 

mxcam_save_eeprom_config: save a specific CONFIG_AREA on camera persistent storage memory

Parameters:
area :area is erase the config area
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • area >= LAST_INFO
MXCAM_ERR_SAVE_UNKNOWN_AREA - unknown save CONFIG_AREA
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
The KEY=VALUE pairs are manipulated in camera's volatile memory,use this API to stored manipulated KEY=VALUE pairs on camera's non volatile memory.
int mxcam_set_key ( CONFIG_AREA  area,
char *  keyname,
char *  value 
)

mxcam_set_key: Add/modify a KEY=VALUE pair on camera's volatile memory

Parameters:
area :area is erase the config area
*keyname :KEY
*value :VALUE
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • area >= LAST_INFO
  • keyname is NULL
  • value is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_SETKEY_OVER_FLOW_NO_MEM - Not enough memory to save new key on memory
MXCAM_ERR_SETKEY_UNKNOWN_AREA - Unkown area to set key
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
Add/modify a KEY=VALUE pair on camera's volatile memory
int mxcam_remove_key ( CONFIG_AREA  area,
char *  keyname 
)

mxcam_remove_key: remove a KEY=VALUE pair on camera's volatile memory

Parameters:
area :area is erase the config area
*keyname :KEY
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • area >= LAST_INFO
  • keyname is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_REMOVE_KEY_UNKNOWN_AREA - Unknown area to remove key
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
remove a KEY=VALUE pair on camera's volatile memory
int mxcam_get_value ( CONFIG_AREA  area,
char *  keyname,
char **  value_out 
)

mxcam_get_value: get VALUE for given KEY from camera's volatile memory

Parameters:
area :area is erase the config area
*keyname :KEY
**value_out :On success VALUE would be copied in *value_out
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • area >= LAST_INFO
  • keyname is NULL
  • value_out is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_GETVALUE_UNKNOWN_AREA - Unknown area to get value
MXCAM_ERR_GETVLAUE_KEY_NOT_FOUND - Value not found for given KEY
MXCAM_ERR_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY - malloc failed
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
get VALUE for given KEY from camera's volatile memory see also mxcam_free_get_value_mem
int mxcam_get_ccrvalue ( char *  keyname,
char **  value_out 
)

mxcam_get_ccrvalue: get VALUE for given CCR KEY from camera's CCR record

Parameters:
*keyname :KEY
**value_out :On success VALUE would be copied in *value_out
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • keyname is NULL
  • value_out is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_GETVLAUE_KEY_NOT_FOUND - Value not found for given KEY
MXCAM_ERR_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY - malloc failed
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
get VALUE for the provided CCR KEY from camera's CCR Record
int mxcam_set_configuration ( EP_CONFIG  config  ) 

mxcam_set_configutaion: set VALUE for configurtion like bulk or isoc to the config descritor

Parameters:
config :config value to be set in config descriptor
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - devhandle is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_DEVICE - Device no booted completely
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
int mxcam_i2c_write ( uint16_t  inst,
uint16_t  type,
i2c_payload_t *  payload 
)

mxcam_i2c_write: will do a i2c write operation in camera

Parameters:
*addr : i2c device address
*subaddr : i2c device register
*value : value to be written
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - devhandle is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_DEVICE - Device not booted completely
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
int mxcam_i2c_read ( uint16_t  inst,
uint16_t  type,
i2c_payload_t *  payload 
)

mxcam_i2c_read: will do a i2c read operation in camera

Parameters:
*addr : i2c device address
*subaddr : i2c device register
*value : return value
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - devhandle is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_DEVICE - Device not booted completely
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success

mxcam_tcw_write: write a SPI device Timing Control Word on camera

Parameters:
value : value to be written
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_DEVICE - Device not booted completely
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
int mxcam_tcw_read ( uint32_t *  value  ) 

mxcam_tcw_read: read SPI Device's Timimg Control Word

Parameters:
*value : return value
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_DEVICE - Device not booted completely
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success

int mxcam_free_get_value_mem ( char *  value_mem  ) 

mxcam_free_get_value_mem: free the resource allocated by mxcam_get_value

Parameters:
*value_mem :pointer to a memory,allocated by mxcam_get_value
Return values:
MXCAM_ERR_INVALID_PARAM - if any one of the following condition meet

  • devhandle is NULL
  • value_mem is NULL
MXCAM_ERR_GETVALUE_UNKNOWN_AREA - Unknown area to get value
MXCAM_ERR_GETVLAUE_KEY_NOT_FOUND - Value not found for given KEY
Negativevalue - upon libusb error
MXCAM_OK - upon success
Remarks:
free the resource allocated by mxcam_get_value
